title.narrative: UN Women EVAW Special Fund - Afghanistan

description.narrative: The purpose of the EVAW Special Fund is to support the Government of Afghanistan and NGOs, with a preference towards national NGOs, to take national actions to eliminate violence against women in Afghanistan; It encourages to seek meaningful partnerships and collaborations with line governmental entities and other stakeholders to achieve their goals and aims the support the creation, expansion, and continuation of direct services, including but not limited to provision of Women Protection Centre, legal aid, and access to justice to women at risk of, as well as to survivors of, violence; Promote and facilitate flexible, predictable, coordinated and participatory funding mechanisms for national and international organizations/institutions as well as governmental institutions involved in the protection of women at risk and women victims of violence in Afghanistan; Contribute to development of a national and multi-sectorial approach to the elimination of violence against women in Afghanistan, through promotion of networking/linkages and documentation of best practices/lessons learned; Develop, strengthen and build the capacity of national organizations to eliminate violence against women. Provide financial and technical support to agencies who provide advocacy, lobby, and awareness raising on VAW. The EVAW Special Fund works towards the elimination of violence against women by supporting programmes in the following five broad categories: a. protection services, reintegration and psychosocial support b. lobby, advocacy and awareness c. legal aid and access to justice d.
